org.apache.juddi.v3.client.config

Class ClientConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juddi.v3.client.config.ClientConfig

  • public class ClientConfig
extends Object
    Handles the client configuration of the uddi-client. By default it first looks at system properties. Then loads from the config file from the system property "uddi.client.xml", next the user specified file, finally, "META-INF/uddi.xml"
    Author:
    Kurt T Stam, Alex O'Ree

    • Method Detail

      • saveConfig

        public void saveConfig()
                throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Attempts to save any changes made to the configuration back to disk Revised in 3.2.1 to reconstruct the file from the in memory data structure, enable you to programmatically add nodes.

        For previous functionality see, saveConfigRaw()
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException

      • saveConfigRaw

        public void saveConfigRaw()
                   throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Use this method to attempt to save the jUDDI configuration file after you've modified it using the Apache Commons Configuration settings. This is especially useful if you've constructed a user interface for manipulating the configuration like a properties sheet and is used by the juddi-gui (web ui)
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Since:
        3.2.1

        protected void readConfig(Properties properties)

        public boolean isRegisterOnStartup()
        signals that the specified classes/wsdls are registered with the UDDI server when UDDIClient.start() is called client.clerks[@registerOnStartup]
        Returns:
        true/false

      • getDigitalSignatureConfiguration

        public Properties getDigitalSignatureConfiguration()
                                            throws Exception
        Fetches all digital signature related properties for the digital signature utility. warning, this will decrypt all passwords
        Returns:
        a properties object
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        DigSigUtil, Properties

      • addUDDINode

        public void addUDDINode(UDDINode node)
                 throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        adds a new node to the client configuration section. Don't forget to call save to persist the changes
        Parameters:
        node -
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Since:
        3.3

      • removeUDDINode

        public void removeUDDINode(String name)
                    throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        removes the named node from the client configuration section. don't forget to save to persist the changes
        Parameters:
        name - expecting the Node name, not the "clientName"
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
